greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Prime-factorization representation of the prime-th Stern-polynomial: a(n) = A260443(A000040(n)).
comment: If the conjecture by Ulas and Ulas is true, then all these terms can be found from A206284 and then this is also a subsequence of A277318.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1028
Maciej Ulas and Oliwia Ulas, On certain arithmetic properties of Stern polynomials, arXiv:1102.5109 [math.CO], 2011.
xref: Cf. A277317 (same sequence sorted into ascending order) is a subsequence of A277319.
Differs from A277318 for the first time at n=10, where A277318(10) = 15750, a term which is missing from this sequence.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 10 2016
